downloadTitle: .NET Rocks! - Miguel de Icaza and Geoff Norton on Mono
downloadDescription: Miguel is back to talk Mono with Geoff Norton. Many things have changed since we last talked to Miguel about the Mono project, an open-source port of the .NET Framework that runs on Windows, Linux, and the Mac. The focus is mostly about running .NET apps on the Mac.
detailsSection:
Miguel de Icaza is the creator and owner of the Mono project. Mono is an open-source implementation of the .NET Framework for Linux and MacOS (as well as Windows).

Geoff Norton is a developer for Novell working on the Mono Project. He's a founder of the Cocoa# and Objective-C# projects and is in charge of the Mac specific development for the Mono project, including a native System.Windows.Forms driver and native Gtk# support. Prior to working for Novell Geoff had been a Mono project contributor for about 3.5 years.
systemRequirementsSection: Presentations are played using the Microsoft Windows Media Player.
installInstructionSection:
- Select "Save this Program to Disk" to copy the download to your machine for installation at a later time.
- Once the file has been downloaded, execute it in order to extract the media file.
